In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country?

                     Health is the primary and important aspect of human life. "Health is wealth" is a famous quote we regularly hear from our elders from many decades,which means if a person is healthy he can make money easily. Health care industry is playing an immense  role in  present scenario. Health care supply and demand are the two major aspects of health care industry. Health care supply is rendering medical and hospitality  services to public in various forms.

Health care industry renders services like diagnostics ,hospitality, surgeries , treatment , sanitary services , nutrition, emergency services(ambulance , ICU ). In India population is growing humongous day by day, this increasing population is one of the reasons of gap between supply and demand. People in urban areas are educated and aware about various medical problems that are popping out day by day and health care industry is very much developed in this areas with higher costs which are not affordable by a middle class family. Most of the  People in rural areas are illiterate and they are not able to meet their basic necessities of life like healthy food, drinking water, sanitary habits ,medical services and healthy environment. Due to lack of these facilities many people are loosing their lives, this results in demand for health care services in both urban areas and rural areas, but supply is very low.

Major steps that can be taken by government:

  • Recruit good doctors ,agents or contractors who render quality services.
  • Government must give a large area for health care services.
  • Purchase machinery which are required for health care and medical services.
  • Government must prevent corruption at all the levels .
  • Provide quality services in a disciplined format
  • Provide services at affordable and reasonable prices
  • Encouraging private hospitals in rural areas
  • Developing Information technology services in rural areas
  • Providing incentives to patients by considering their economical status.
  • Hospitals must maintain hygiene standards
  • Environment of hospital or medical areas must b docile.
  • Conducting regular camps to different rural areas and providing them medical services
  • Educating people regarding hygiene, health ,food and sanitation
  • providing free medicines , food, treatment.

Health care industries are accounting more to employment and GDP but some times failing in providing quality services . Government should follow strict rules and regulations to improve the standards. Government must consider all complaints ands requests of general public and go according to their needs with regard of services and facilities. Health of the people should be main motive of government. Government must be able to balance between supply and demand.
